titleStmt.title: Songs and Psalmes composed into 3.4. and 5. parts for the vse and delight of all such as either loue or learne musicke: By John Mundy gentleman, bachiler of musicke, and one of the organest of hir Maiesties free chappell of VVindsor.
titleStmt.author: Mundy, John, d. 1630.

titleStmt.title: Songs and Psalmes composed into 3.4. and 5. parts for the vse and delight of all such as either loue or learne musicke: By John Mundy gentleman, bachiler of musicke, and one of the organest of hir Maiesties free chappell of VVindsor.
titleStmt.author: Mundy, John, d. 1630.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Thomas Est, (the assigne of William Byrd,) dwelling in Aldersgate street, at the signe of the black Horse,

notesStmt.note: In five parts: superius, contratenor, medius, tenor, bassus, each with separate title page.
Copy filmed consists of Superius only.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
